document_title: Left testicular pain: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Left testicle pain can recover quickly or leave permanent damage and even loss of fertility if not treated promptly. Some easily recognizable symptoms include: (2)
Sudden, severe pain in the left testicle; Dull pain from the left testicle, spreading to the lower abdomen; Swelling, redness and pain in the scrotum and left testicle; The left testicle is in an abnormal position.
In addition, some accompanying symptoms may be experienced, including:
Abnormal discharge from the penis; Burning when urinating; Change in frequency of urination; Appearance of blood in urine.; Cloudy urine.; A feeling of itching and irritation appears inside the penis; Fever and chills.; Vomiting, nausea.; Tired body.
subsection_title: dau tinh hoan ben trai.json. Symptoms of left testicular pain
